introduction: Scientific research into the relationship between what we eat and how we feel is growing. In this pr

vocabulary.definition: eating too much food because of how you feel, not because you’re hungry
vocabulary.example: She tends to engage in emotional eating when she's stressed out from work.
His appetite for spicy food has increased since he started trying different cuisines.

vocabulary.definition: take something quickly because you don’t have much time
vocabulary.example: In the morning rush, I usually grab and go a granola bar for breakfast.
His idea of building a rocket-powered skateboard seemed a bit bananas to everyone else.

vocabulary.definition: move your eyes upwards to show you feel annoyed, bored or don’t believe what someone is telling you
vocabulary.example: She rolled her eyes when he made the same excuse for being late again.

vocabulary.definition: speak or behave towards someone as if they were stupid or unimportant
vocabulary.example: The salesperson's patronizing tone made the customer feel belittled.
